channel.title: Civ5
channel.description:
Is there anyway to skip the turn without having to give orders to ALL of my available units?
[img]http://img232.imageshack.us/img232/619/helpb0.jpg[/img]
Also, is it compulsory to have every city producing something always?

item.title: Civ5
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

Mopman:

you only have to do it once, you can have the awake when something comes near them

Even once is a lot with my army. I feel like I’ve got too many units, I should delete some.

Read full topic

item.title: Civ5
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

you only have to do it once, you can have the awake when something comes near them

Read full topic

item.title: Civ5
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:2, topic:370637”]You can set cities to produce wealth or research and they’ll do that for you indefinitely until you change them.
You can also tell units to fortify somewhere or just sleep them?[/quote]

Thanks champ. I was hoping there was an alternative to sleeping because with the amount of units in my army, even commanding them to sleep would be a hassle.

I didn’t know that the research/wealth production goes on indefinitely, so that was helpful.

Read full topic

item.title: Civ5
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

You can set cities to produce wealth or research and they’ll do that for you indefinitely until you change them.
You can also tell units to fortify somewhere or just sleep them?
